Name: Alter
Description:
The Force user can tap into the Living Force of their surroundings, manipulating the nearby environs.
The Force user may spend :ldsp: to make all terrain currently within short range difficult terrain until the end of their next turn.
The Force user may spend :ldsp: to make all terrain currently within short range normal terrain until the end of their next turn.

Name: Battle Meditation
Description:
The Force user directs allies in battle, making them more effective as a coordinated unit.
The user may spend :ldsp: to add one automatic :suc: to all checks made by a number of engaged friendly targets up to his Presence before the end of his next turn. If the user used an :dsp: to generate :ldsp: , reduce each target’s Willpower by 1 (to a minimum of 1) until the end of the encounter.

Name: Bind
Description:
The Force user restrains an enemy, preventing the target from acting.
The user may spend :ldsp: to immobilize a target within short range until the end of the user’s next turn. If the user used any :dsp: to generate :ldsp:, the target also suffers 1 wound per :ldsp: spent on the check (ignoring soak).

Name: Conjure
Description:
The Force user calls forth a spectral object to their hand, which lasts for a short time.
The user may spend :ldsp: to create a facsimile of a Brawl or Melee weapon anywhere within engaged range. At the end of the user’s next turn, this item dissipates. At the GM’s discretion, the user can instead conjure a simple tool and other useful low-tech item with an encumbrance no greater than 1.

Name: Ebb/Flow
Description:
The Force user’s actions empower himself or sap strength from his foes.
Ebb: When the Force user makes a skill check, he may roll an Ebb power check as part of the roll. The user may spend :ldsp: to suffer 1 strain, then inflict 1 strain on all other engaged characters. The Force user may not activate this multiple times.
Flow: When the Force user makes a skill check, he may roll a Flow power check as part of the roll. The user may spend :ldsp: to heal 1 strain. The Force user may not activate this multiple times.

Name: Endure
Description: When the character suffers a Critical Injury with a severity no greater than Easy (:pu:), the character may activate Endure as an out of turn incidental and commit :wh: to temporarily ignore the effects of that injury. The character does not apply any results from the Critical Injury or add +10 to further rolls on the Critical Injury Result table while :wh: remains committed. When this ongoing effect ends, the character suffers all effects of the Critical Injury (unless it has been treated).

Name: Enhance
Description:
When making an Athletics check, the Force user may roll an Enhance power check as part of the pool.
The user may spend :lsp: to gain :suc: or :adv: (user’s choice) on the check.

Name: Farsight
Description:
The Force user expands normal visual senses through a connection to the Force.
The user may spend :ldsp: to ignore the effects of darkness or blindness and see normally at up to medium range for the remainder of the round (or one minute).
This allows the user to view everything most sentients could normally be able to see on a well-lit day.

Name: Foresee
Description:
The Force user can feel the Force flowing around everything, seeing what is and what will be.
The user may spend :lsp: to gain vague hints of events to come, up to a day into his future.

Name: Heal/Harm
Description:
The Force user bolsters his ally with renewed vigor or saps his foe of vital energy.
Heal (Light side Force user only): Spend :ldsp: to heal a number of wound equal to Intellect from an engaged living creature (including user).
Harm: Spend :ldsp: to inflict a number of wounds equal to Intellect (ignoring soak) on an engaged living target. The user gains 1 Conflict.

Name: Imbue
Description:
The Force user lends strength to allies, making them more potent, resourceful, or resilient for a time.
The user may spend :ldsp: :ldsp: to increase one of another engaged character’s characteristics by 1 (to a maximum of 6) until the end of the Force user’s next turn.
This can only be used once per character per encounter. If the user uses :dsp: to generate :ldsp:, the target increases a second characteristic by 1 (to a maximum of 6) until the end of the user’s next turn, but both the Force user and the target suffer 3 strain.

Name: Influence
Description:
The character may attempt to guide, shape, and even twist the thoughts and feelings of others.
Special Rule (:lsp:/:dsp: use): When guiding and shaping thoughts, only :dsp: may be used to generate negative emotions such as rage, fear, and hatred. Only :lsp: may be used to generate positive emotions such as peace, tranquility, and friendliness. Other emotions such as confusion can be generated with either :lsp: or :dsp:.
The character may spend :lsp: to stress the mind of one living target he is engaged with, inflicting 1 strain.

Name: Jerserra's Influence
Description:
The Force user can project terrifying visions onto foes, forcing them to face their greatest fears.
The user may spend :ldsp: to target one character within short range. That character must immediately make an Average (:pu: :pu:) fear check as an out of turn incidental.

Name: Manipulate
Description:
The Force user shapes machine components on a molecular level, allowing him to mend damaged mechanical systems.
The Force user may spend :ldsp: to cause one vehicle or starship he is engaged with to recover one system strain. The user may activate this multiple times.

Name: Misdirect
Description:
The Force user creates illusions to fool those around him.
The user may spend :ldsp: to make a target at up to short range unable to perceive a chosen person or object of silhouette 1 or smaller. Until the beginning of the user’s next turn, the target cannot see or sense the hidden person or object.

Name: Move
Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
The user may spend :lsp: to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

Name: Protect/Unleash
Description:
The Force user guides the flow of energy, protecting himself and others or unleashing blast of power upon his foes.
Protect: The user makes a Protect power check and rolls an Average (:pu: :pu:) Discipline check as part of the pool. Spend :ldsp: :ldsp: to reduce damage from an energy-based weapon that hits himself or an engaged character by amount equal to Willpower plus 1 per :suc:. Dark side Force users may only protect themselves.
Unleash: The user makes an Unleash power check as ranged attack and rolls an Average (:pu: :pu:) Discipline check for difficulty. If check succeeds and spends :ldsp: :ldsp:, the attack hits. It has a range of short, a base damage equal to Willpower, and a critical rating of 4. The user gains 1 Conflict.

Name: Seek
Description:
The Force user allows the will of the Force to lead the way to something lost or forgotten.
The user may spend :ldsp: :ldsp: to gain insight into the general location or direction of a person or object that he knows about, regardless of current distance.
The user may spend :ldsp: and succeed at an Average (:pu: :pu:) Vigilance check (or opposed Vigilance vs. Discipline check) to see through illusions.

Name: Sense
Description:
The Force user can sense the Force interacting with the world around him.
The user may spend :lsp: to sense all living things within short range (including sentient and non-sentient beings).
The user may spend :lsp: to sense the current emotional state of one living target with whom he is engaged.

Name: Suppress
Description:
The Force user can dampen the effect of incoming Force powers, dramatically diminishing their effects on himself and his allies.
The user may spend :ldsp: to add automatic :fai: to Force power checks made against him or any ally within short range until the end of his next turn.

Name: Warde's Foresight
Description:
The Force user can feel the Force flowing around another specific individual to gain insight into what that person might do.
The user may spend :ldsp: to gain hints about what another individual within short range is likely to do in the near future.
